definition: (lit.) a pot of porridge/(fig.) a complete mess
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
lit. a piece of rat feces spoiled the whole pot of congee (idiom)/fig. one bad apple can spoil the whole bunch
pinyin: yi1 li4 lao3 shu3 shi3 huai4 le5 yi1 guo1 zhou1
containing_words.word: 一粒老鼠屎壞了一鍋粥

definition: see 一粒老鼠屎壞了一鍋粥|一粒老鼠屎坏了一锅粥[yi1 li4 lao3 shu3 shi3 huai4 le5 yi1 guo1 zhou1]
pinyin: yi1 ke1 lao3 shu3 shi3 huai4 le5 yi1 guo1 zhou1
containing_words.word: 一顆老鼠屎壞了一鍋粥

sentences.english: Uncle Gen arrived at Old Wang's house to see everything was in a mess.
sentences.chinese: 根叔到老王家時，正亂成一鍋粥。

sentences.english: From Shanghai, Wuhan, let alone anything difficult. New continents of Europe, let alone what has become a mess image.
sentences.chinese: 從新洲，到歐洲，別說什麼事都亂成了一鍋粥。

sentences.english: Foley scandal has messed up the whole Republican Party.
sentences.chinese: 弗利醜聞使整個共和黨亂成了一鍋粥。

sentences.english: In a monetary union, irresponsibility by one member endangers the well-being of others.
sentences.chinese: 在一個貨幣聯盟內，一顆老鼠屎可以壞了一鍋粥。
